subject: Philosophy
title: Attention and Blindness
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Attention and Blindness.

hook.text: In a famous experiment, people watching a basketball game failed to notice a gorilla walking through the scene.

buildup.text: Inattentional blindness shows that you only see what you're paying attention to. The rest vanishes.

discovery.text: Your brain filters out far more than it lets in. Consciousness is a spotlight, not a floodlight.

twist.text: This means your experience of the world is always incomplete. You're missing most of what's happening.

climax.text: Attention doesn't just select what you see. It constructs what you see. No attention, no experience.

punchline.text: If you're not paying attention, it didn't happen â€” for you.

quiz.question: What does inattentional blindness demonstrate?
options: We fail to perceive things we aren't paying attention to
